Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2013 03:40AM chasingdreams wrote: ok, i am not suggesting your nipple is cause for concern or not, but i believe u must make sure it is looked at and taken seriously by your dr. sounds like the situation is....... unlike my mothers inverted nipple was. my mom's only s/sx of her newly dx ILC was her nipple began to invert 5yrs ago. it has progressively gotten worse over time to point it isn't even there. and of course her tumor is right there under it with multiple cords... and yes, she did have mams yearly and she brought nipple up to dr repeatedly :( she even said she was worried it was sign of breast ca! guess what? it IS! it is one of few visible s/ of ILC.... goodluck and plz post a f/u?
